intro: Hieracium persubtile, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Hieracium persubtile is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
